weekly_top_story.headline: White House Expands Most-Favored-Nation Program to GLP-1 Therapies
weekly_top_story.summary: The White House announced new most-favored-nation (MFN) agreements with major manufacturers of GLP-1 drugs, extending lower prices and expanded Medicare coverage for obesity treatments for the first time.

stories.headline: Medical Orgs Press Anthem To Pull Back Out-Of-Network Policy
stories.summary: Three major medical organizations urged Anthem to rescind a new policy penalizing hospitals for using out-of-network providers, citing operational challenges and potential harm to patient care.

stories.headline: Hospital-At-Home Waiver Uncertainty Remains After Shutdown
stories.summary: Health systems are reevaluating hospital-at-home programs after the government shutdown, with the CMS Acute Hospital Care at Home waiver extended only until January due to ongoing legislative uncertainty.

stories.headline: Telehealth Flexibilities Expire Amid Government Shutdown
stories.summary: Lawmakers failed to extend telehealth flexibilities, resulting in millions of Americans losing access to virtual care coverage and reverting to previous restrictions.
